overview: From 2025-08-27 to 2025-08-28, elizaos/eliza had 8 new PRs (7 merged), 2 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Fix Windows path handling in CLI agent start command tests
topIssues.author: linear
topIssues.body:
\## Description

\### Summary

Windows CI tests are failing due to incorrect path handling when running \`elizaos agent start\` with the \`--path\` flag. The file path is being malformed, resulting in doubled/concatenated paths with embedded quotes.

\### Error Details

The test command:

\`\`\`bash

elizaos agent start --remote-url http://localhost:3000 --path "D:\\a\\eliza\\eliza\\packages\\cli\\tests\\test-characters\\max.json"

\`\`\`

Results in this malformed path:

\`\`\`

D:\\a\\eliza\\eliza\\packages\\cli\\"D:\\a\\eliza\\eliza\\packages\\cli\\tests\\test-characters\\max.json"

\`\`\`

Error message:

\`\`\`

error: File not found at path: D:\\a\\eliza\\eliza\\packages\\cli\\"D:\\a\\eliza\\eliza\\packages\\cli\\tests\\test-characters\\max.json"

\`\`\`

\### Root Cause

The path resolution in \`packages/cli/src/commands/agent.ts\` (around the \`startAgent\` function) is not properly handling quoted paths on Windows. When \`path.resolve(process.cwd(), options.path)\` is called, it's incorrectly concatenating the current working directory with an already-absolute path.

\### Affected Code

\- File: \`packages/cli/dist/chunk-KKAK7OQA.js\` (compiled from source)

\- Line: Around line 3326 where \`path12.resolve(process.cwd(), options.path)\` is called

\- Source likely in: \`packages/cli/src/commands/agent.ts\` or related agent command files

\### Reproduction

Only occurs on Windows systems when running:

\`\`\`bash

bun test packages/cli/tests/create-commands.test.ts

\`\`\`

\### Proposed Fix

1\. Check if the provided path is already absolute before calling \`path.resolve()\`

2\. Handle Windows path separators and quoted paths correctly

3\. Add unit tests specifically for Windows path scenarios

\### Example Fix

\`\`\`typescript

*// Instead of:*

const filePath = path.resolve(process.cwd(), options.path);

*// Use:*

const inputPath = options.path.replace(/^"|"$/g, ''); *// Remove surrounding quotes*

const filePath = path.isAbsolute(inputPath)

? inputPath

: path.resolve(process.cwd(), inputPath);

\`\`\`

\### Priority

High - Blocking CI/CD pipeline

\### Labels

\- bug

\- windows

\- cli

\- ci-failure

topPRs.title: fix: CI test failures in core and cypress tests
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes failing CI tests in the core packages and cypress component tests identified in the develop branch CI runs.

### Changes Made

#### project-tee-starter tests
- Updated all references from `tsup.config.ts` to `build.ts` to match the actual build system
- Fixed test expectations to align with the new build configuration
- Skipped vite build test as build.ts does not run vite build

#### plugin-dummy-services tests  
- Implemented missing methods in service classes:
  - Added `getPools`, `getLpPositionDetails`, `getMarketDataForPools` to DummyLpService
  - Added `getTokenDetails`, `getTrendingTokens`, `searchTokens`, `getTokensByAddresses` to DummyTokenDataService
  - Fixed wallet service portfolio structure
- Added all required properties for test compatibility:
  - Added `value` property to wallet portfolio assets
  - Added missing fields like `holders`, `liquidity`, `priceChange24hPercent` to token data
  - Fixed LP position details structure

#### Cypress tests
- All component tests were already passing - no changes needed
- E2E tests require running servers which is expected behavior

### Test Results
- ✅ project-tee-starter: All 92 tests passing (2 skipped)
- ✅ plugin-dummy-services: All 43 tests passing 
- ✅ client cypress component tests: All 294 tests passing

### Notes
- Ignored Windows CLI CI tests as requested
- E2E tests were not fixed as they require running servers (client dev server + API server)
- All fixes maintain backward compatibility

Fixes test failures from CI runs on develop branch.

topPRs.title: fix: Improve browser build exports and type definitions
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes issues with the browser build of the core package and improves type definitions.

## Changes

### Build Configuration Updates
- **Package.json exports**: Updated to use `.node.js` and `.browser.js` suffixes for better clarity
- **Deno support**: Added `deno` export condition for improved Deno compatibility
- **Type definitions**: Fixed to re-export from source modules instead of compiled output
- **Fallback declarations**: Added fallback declaration files for both node and browser builds

### Type Annotation Improvements
- **entities.ts**: Added explicit type annotation to `results` array
- **logger.ts**: Added explicit type annotation for `stream` variable
- **roles.ts**: Added explicit type annotation to `ownerWorlds` array

### Other Changes
- Added `standalone.ts` to `.gitignore`
- Minor formatting improvements

## Why These Changes Are Needed

1. **Browser builds were not properly resolving types** - The previous configuration was causing issues when importing the package in browser environments
2. **Type safety** - The explicit type annotations prevent `any` types from creeping into the codebase
3. **Module resolution** - The updated export paths and fallback declarations ensure proper module resolution across different environments (Node.js, Browser, Deno)

## Testing

- [ ] Browser build compiles successfully
- [ ] Type definitions are properly resolved in consuming applications
- [ ] No regression in Node.js environments
- [ ] Deno can properly import the module

## Related Issues

Fixes issues with browser builds not properly resolving types and improves overall module resolution.
